title.narrative: CAREGIVERS/PARENTS ENSURE MORE CHILDRENIN SCHOOLS AND ECD/EARLY LEARNING CENTRES

description.narrative: Mothers, fathers and caregivers in selected provinces have improved understanding of the value of sending girls and boys, including children with disabilities, to school, including to early childhood education centres., which contributes to Access To Quality Learning Opportunities, Learning, Skills, Participation And Engagement. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Advocacy And Communications, Advocacy And Public Engagement, Community Engagement, Social And Behaviour Change, Harnessing Power Of Business And Markets, Operational Support To Programme Delivery, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building, United Nations Working Together. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: By 2022, school aged girls and boy, especially the most marginalized, successfully complete pre-primary and primary education.

UPNG SCHOOL OF MEDICINE AND HEALTH SCIENCE

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: Mothers, fathers and caregivers in selected provinces have improved understanding of the value of sending girls and boys, includingchildren with disabilities, to school, including to early childhood education centres.

description.narrative: Highlighted in the Behaviour Management Policy (BMP), safe school norms and positive attitudes and behaviours among students and teachers were promoted at the school level through training of teachers mobilisation of head of schools, and teachers. This contributed to the positive behaviour change of 710 students (366 female) in gender-equitable attitudes.; | Status:On-track | As-of Date:29/12/2021

title.narrative: ECE Committees are formed and operationalized in each centres (involving parents and local communities). (52384)
